item.title: The (Jewish) Christian Question
item.dc:creator: Yitzhak Lewis
item.description: A comment on Gil Anidjar’s paper “Jesus and Monotheism” and its discussion at the MESAAS department colloquium on September 11th. Murder, it soon becomes clear, goes far beyond the “who-done-it?” digressions, down which Freud (and Anidjar) takes his readers. This word designates more than a crime, far more than an action. It describes a kind … Continue reading The (Jewish) Christian Question →
